meanings.definition: The act of refusing or declining something.
meanings.sent1: Her multiple refusals to eat the vegetables showed her strong dislike for them.
meanings.sent2: The refusals to join the club surprised everyone as she was usually very sociable.
meanings.sent3: His refusals to share his toys with his little sister always led to playful arguments.
meanings.sent4: The refusals of the stubborn old man were as solid as a brick wall.
meanings.sent5: The refusals echoed loudly in the empty room, emphasizing her determination.

meanings.definition: A denial or rejection of a request or offer.
meanings.sent1: The refusals of the company to negotiate further disappointed the employees.
meanings.sent2: Despite his refusals, she kept insisting on helping him with his project.
meanings.sent3: The refusals of the cat to play with the new toy amused the children.
meanings.sent4: Her refusals were like arrows, piercing through his hopes and dreams.
meanings.sent5: The refusals hung in the air, creating an awkward silence in the room.
